step_data.goal: Understand how subgroup membership works and how permissions are inherited

	[232] main ''
		[235] heading 'Subgroups (FREE)'
			[237] strong ''
				StaticText '(FREE)'
		[238] blockquote ''
			[239] paragraph ''
				[240] link 'Introduced', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/-/issues/2772'
				StaticText 'in GitLab 9.0.'
		[241] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'You can organize GitLab'
			[242] link 'groups', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/help/user/group/index.md'
			StaticText 'into subgroups. You can use subgroups to:'
		[243] list ''
			[244] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'Separate internal and external organizations. Because every subgroup can have its own'
				[245] link 'visibility level', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/help/development/permissions.md#general-permissions'
				StaticText ', you can host groups for different purposes under the same parent group.'
			[246] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'Organize large projects. You can use subgroups to give different access to parts of the source code.'
			[247] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'Manage people and control visibility. Give a user a different'
				[248] link 'role', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/help/user/permissions.md#group-members-permissions'
				StaticText "for each group they're"
				[249] link 'a member of', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/help/user/group/subgroups/index#subgroup-membership'
				StaticText '.'
		[250] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'Subgroups can:'
		[251] list ''
			[252] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'Belong to one immediate parent group.'
			[253] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'Have many subgroups.'
			[254] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'Be nested up to 20 levels.'
			[255] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'Use'
				[256] link 'runners', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/help/ci/runners/index.md'
				StaticText 'registered to parent groups:'
				[257] list ''
					[258] listitem ''
						ListMarker '◦'
						StaticText 'Secrets configured for the parent group are available to subgroup jobs.'
					[259] listitem ''
						ListMarker '◦'
						StaticText 'Users with the Maintainer role in projects that belong to subgroups can see the details of runners registered to parent groups.'
		[260] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'For example:'
		[263] code ''
			StaticText 'graph TD'
			StaticText ''
			StaticText 'subgraph "Parent group"'
			StaticText ''
			StaticText 'subgraph "Subgroup A"'
			StaticText ''
			StaticText 'subgraph "Subgroup A1"'
			StaticText ''
			StaticText 'G["Project E"]'
			StaticText ''
			StaticText 'end'
			StaticText ''
			StaticText 'C["Project A"]'
			StaticText ''
			StaticText 'D["Project B"]'
			StaticText ''
			StaticText 'E["Project C"]'
			StaticText ''
			StaticText 'end'
			StaticText ''
			StaticText 'subgraph "Subgroup B"'
			StaticText ''
			StaticText 'F["Project D"]'
			StaticText ''
			StaticText 'end'
			StaticText ''
			StaticText 'end'

		[281] heading 'View subgroups of a group'
		[283] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'Prerequisite:'
		[284] list ''
			[285] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'To view private nested subgroups, you must be a direct or inherited member of the private subgroup.'
		[286] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'To view the subgroups of a group:'
		[287] list ''
			[288] listitem ''
				ListMarker '0.'
				StaticText 'On the top bar, select'
				[289] strong ''
					StaticText 'Main menu > Groups'
				StaticText 'and find your group.'
			[290] listitem ''
				ListMarker '0.'
				StaticText 'Select the'
				[291] strong ''
					StaticText 'Subgroups and projects'
				StaticText 'tab.'
			[292] listitem ''
				ListMarker '0.'
				StaticText 'To view a nested subgroup, expand a subgroup in the hierarchy list.'
		[293] heading 'Private subgroups in public parent groups'
		[295] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'In the hierarchy list, public groups with a private subgroup have an expand option ('
			[296] strong ''
				StaticText '{chevron-down}'
			StaticText ') for all users that indicate there is a subgroup. When users who are not direct or inherited members of the private subgroup select expand ('
			[297] strong ''
				StaticText '{chevron-down}'
			StaticText '), the nested subgroup does not display.'
		[298] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'If you prefer to keep information about the presence of nested subgroups private, we advise that you only add private subgroups to private parent groups.'
		[299] heading 'Create a subgroup'
		[301] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'Prerequisites:'
		[302] list ''
			[303] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'You must either:'
				[304] list ''
					[305] listitem ''
						ListMarker '◦'
						StaticText 'Have at least the Maintainer role for a group to create subgroups for it.'
					[306] listitem ''
						ListMarker '◦'
						StaticText 'Have the'
						[307] link 'role determined by a setting', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/help/user/group/subgroups/index#change-who-can-create-subgroups'
						StaticText '. These users can create subgroups even if group creation is'
						[308] link 'disabled by an Administrator', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/help/user/admin_area/index.md#prevent-a-user-from-creating-groups'
						StaticText "in the user's settings."
		[309] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'NOTE: You cannot host a GitLab Pages subgroup website with a top-level domain name. For example,'
			[310] code ''
				StaticText 'subgroupname.example.io'
			StaticText '.'
		[311] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'To create a subgroup:'
		[312] list ''
			[313] listitem ''
				ListMarker '0.'
				StaticText 'On the top bar, select'
				[314] strong ''
					StaticText 'Main menu > Groups'
				StaticText 'and find and select the parent group to add a subgroup to.'
			[315] listitem ''
				ListMarker '0.'
				StaticText "On the parent group's overview page, in the top right, select"
				[316] strong ''
					StaticText 'New subgroup'
				StaticText '.'
			[317] listitem ''
				ListMarker '0.'
				StaticText 'Select'
				[318] strong ''
					StaticText 'Create group'
				StaticText '.'
			[319] listitem ''
				ListMarker '0.'
				StaticText 'Fill in the fields. View a list of'
				[320] link 'reserved names', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/help/user/reserved_names.md'
				StaticText 'that cannot be used as group names.'
			[321] listitem ''
				ListMarker '0.'
				StaticText 'Select'
				[322] strong ''
					StaticText 'Create group'
				StaticText '.'
		[323] heading 'Change who can create subgroups'
		[325] paragraph ''
			StaticText "To create a subgroup, you must have at least the Maintainer role on the group, depending on the group's setting. By default:"
		[326] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'To change who can create subgroups on a group:'
		[327] list ''
			[328] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'As a user with the Owner role on the group:'
				[329] list ''
					[330] listitem ''
						ListMarker '0.'
						StaticText 'On the top bar, select'
						[331] strong ''
							StaticText 'Main menu > Groups'
						StaticText 'and find your group.'
					[332] listitem ''
						ListMarker '0.'
						StaticText 'On the left sidebar, select'

					[334] listitem ''
						ListMarker '0.'
						StaticText 'Expand'
						[335] strong ''

					[336] listitem ''

						StaticText 'Select a role from'

						StaticText '.'
					[338] listitem ''

						[339] strong ''

			[340] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'

				[341] list ''
					[342] listitem ''
						ListMarker '0.'

						[343] strong ''

						StaticText '.'
					[344] listitem ''
						ListMarker '0.'
						StaticText 'On the left sidebar, select'
						[345] strong ''
							StaticText 'Overview > Groups'
						StaticText '.'
					[346] listitem ''
						ListMarker '0.'

						[347] strong ''

					[348] listitem ''
						ListMarker '0.'
						StaticText 'Select a role from'
						[349] strong ''
							StaticText 'Allowed to create subgroups'

					[350] listitem ''
						ListMarker '0.'

						[351] strong ''

		[352] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'For more information, view the'
			[353] link 'permissions table', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/help/user/permissions.md#group-members-permissions'
			StaticText '.'
		[354] heading 'Subgroup membership'
		[356] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'NOTE: There is a bug that causes some pages in the parent group to be accessible by subgroup members. For more details, see'
			[357] link 'this issue', url='https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/340421'
			StaticText '.'
		[358] paragraph ''
			StaticText "When you add a member to a group, that member is also added to all subgroups. The user's permissions are inherited from the group's parent."
		[359] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'Subgroup members can:'
		[360] list ''
			[361] listitem ''
				ListMarker '0.'
				StaticText 'Be'
				[362] link 'direct members', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/help/user/project/members/index.md#add-users-to-a-project'
				StaticText 'of the subgroup.'
			[363] listitem ''
				ListMarker '0.'
				[364] link 'Inherit membership', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/help/user/project/members/index.md#inherited-membership'
				StaticText "of the subgroup from the subgroup's parent group."
			[365] listitem ''
				ListMarker '0.'
				StaticText 'Be a member of a group that was'
				[366] link "shared with the subgroup's top-level group", url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/help/user/group/manage.md#share-a-group-with-another-group'
				StaticText '.'

			[446] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'User 3 is a direct member of group'
				[447] emphasis ''
					StaticText 'Four'
				StaticText '. This means they get their Maintainer role directly from group'
				[448] emphasis ''
					StaticText 'Four'
				StaticText '.'
			[449] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'Administrator has the Owner role on group'
				[450] emphasis ''
					StaticText 'Four'
				StaticText 'and is a member of all subgroups. For that reason, as with User 3, the'
				[451] strong ''
					StaticText 'Source'
				StaticText 'column indicates they are a direct member.'
		[452] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'Members can be'
			[453] link 'filtered by inherited or direct membership', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/help/user/group/manage.md#filter-a-group'
			StaticText '.'
		[454] heading 'Override ancestor group membership'
		[456] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'Users with the Owner role on a subgroup can add members to it.'
		[457] paragraph ''
			StaticText "You can't give a user a role on a subgroup that's lower than the roles they have on ancestor groups. To override a user's role on an ancestor group, add the user to the subgroup again with a higher role. For example:"
		[458] list ''
			[459] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'If User 1 is added to group'
				[460] emphasis ''
					StaticText 'Two'
				StaticText 'with the Developer role, they inherit that role in every subgroup of group'
				[461] emphasis ''
					StaticText 'Two'
				StaticText '.'
			[462] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'To give User 1 the Maintainer role on group'
				[463] emphasis ''
					StaticText 'Four'
				StaticText '(under'
				[464] emphasis ''
					StaticText 'One / Two / Three'
				StaticText '), add them again to group'
				[465] emphasis ''
					StaticText 'Four'
				StaticText 'with the Maintainer role.'
			[466] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'If User 1 is removed from group'
				[467] emphasis ''
					StaticText 'Four'
				StaticText ', their role falls back to their role on group'
				[468] emphasis ''
					StaticText 'Two'
				StaticText '. They have the Developer role on group'
				[469] emphasis ''
					StaticText 'Four'
				StaticText 'again.'
		[470] heading 'Mention subgroups'
		[472] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'Mentioning subgroups ('
			[473] link '@<subgroup_name>', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/help/user/discussions/index.md#mentions'
				[474] code ''
					StaticText '@<subgroup_name>'
			StaticText ') in issues, commits, and merge requests notifies all direct members of that group. Inherited members of a subgroup are not notified by mentions. Mentioning works the same as for projects and groups, and you can choose the group of people to be notified.'
step_data.thought: I've scrolled through the page and found the 'Subgroup membership' section which explains how membership works and permission inheritance. Let me continue reading to ensure I fully understand the details about overriding ancestor group membership and other related concepts. I need to see if there's more information below my current view.
